paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

functional_data.summary: The mutation likely inactivated the BRCA2 protein, a tumor suppressor essential for homologous recombination repair.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence for pathogenicity based on functional impact.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is characterized as a truncal mutation in the tumor phylogeny.
key_quotes: ConDoR reveals that the tumor analyzed here is driven by a truncal BRCA2 stop-gained mutation (p.Y600*), which likely inactivated the BRCA2 protein, a tumor suppressor essential for homologous recombination repair.

extraction_metadata.notes: No individual-level penetrance data was available.
